p: Nanotechnology through a large variety of nanomaterials (NMs) possessing multiple structures, properties, and characteristics can offer a revolutionary solution for the control and treatment of this disease. Many types of NMs showed very promising antiviral and antimicrobial activities which could be used as nano-vaccines to prevent microbial biofilm formation and the adsorption of microbes onto the surfaces and to control their transmission as shown in Fig.Â 1 (Abd Elkodous et al. 2019a, b; 2020; Chen and Liang 2020; El-Sayyad et al. 2020; Kim et al. 2020; Mohamed et al. 2020; Tran et al. 2020; Wong et al. 2020).
